name: Covarion.ts98
title: The Tuffley-Steel Covarion Model

citation.title: Modeling the covarion hypothesis of nucleotide substitution

args.description: Fraction of time spent in the ON state.

description:
The Tuffley-Steel covarion model splits every state into an ON and an OFF version, increasing the number of states by a factor of 2.  Rates for the ON version are given by the rate matrix Q of the submodel, while rates for the OFF version are 0:

   rate ( (ON , state1) -> (ON , state2) ) = Q(state1, state2)
   rate ( (OFF, state1) -> (OFF, state2) ) = 0

Rates for switching between ON and OFF are given by the s01 and s10 parameters, and are independent of the submodel state.

   rate ( (ON , state ) -> (OFF, state ) ) = s10
   rate ( (OFF, state ) -> (ON , state ) ) = s01

Rates for changing the level (ON,OFF) and the state at the same time are 0.

We parameterize s01 and s10 by:

    pi1 = s01/(s10 + s01)
    r   = s01 + s01,
where pi1 is the fraction of time spent in the ON state.  The total rate of switching between states is:
    rate = 2*r*pi1*(1-pi1)

The priors avoid placing too much mass on boundary conditions where this model reduces to a simpler model.
